remarks: | border routers       | contact                    |
| rajesh.prauscher.de  | mail & xmpp:               |
|                      |  prauscher@prauscher.de    |
|                      | hackint: prauscher         |
| willing to peer! to simplify this process, follow |
| some simple steps:                                |
| 1. check which of the border routers (see list    |
|    above) is closest using e.g. ping              |
| 2. contact me and include at least these          |
|    information:                                   |
|    * my endpoint (result of step 1)               |
|    * your contact information, including at least |
|      your nick, mail and gpg-key                  |
|    * information about the tunnel: IPv4 or        |
|      hostname of your endpoint and internal IPv4  |
|      if you prefer a specific lport for your      |
|      tunnel, please include this information!     |
|    * your as-number for bgp-setup                 |
|    to ease configuration please use the following |
|    format (each field seperated by whitespace):   |
|    NICK MAIL GPG AS YOUR_ENDPOINT INTERNAL IPV4   |
|    [PREFERED PORT]                                |
| 3. i will add configuration for the peering on my |
|    router. this includes generation of linklocal- |
|    IPv6-addresses for the tunnel aswell as the    |
|    static openvpn-key and adding needed settings  |
|    to the router.                                 |
| 4. you will receive a pgp-encrypted mail          |
|    including your openvpn-configuration and the   |
|    IPs to use in BGP-sessions                     |
| 5. you apply the settings, routing should go up   |
| steps 3 and 4 are executed by a script you can    |
| find at github: http://goo.gl/DL30PA              |
